title.narrative: Capacity building on implementation of CE policy Peru

description.narrative: Peru is eager to make the shift towards a Circular Economy (CE). The Peruvian Ministry of Production has launched a national Roadmap for CE in the industrial sector of Peru in 2018. Nevertheless, Peru is still facing a couple of challenges in implementing its ambitious plans. This inception mission will identify the local circular ecosystem, key players, quick wins as well as leads for future Dutch involvement. Focus sectors are waste and industrial production.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of parties formally starting a business collaboration and/or partnership - Local private parties

comment.narrative: 6 CE projects were designed by the municipalities of La Molina, Pueblo Libre, Callao, Lima and San Juan de Lurigancho. The projects include cooperation for waste management activities with : - 3 small scale waste recycler associations: Iindependent recyclers association -ATRIMAC; Environmental recyclers association -ATRAC; and United workers of Callao association -ATURCA). - Independent recyclers identfied by the local municipalities.

title.narrative: Number of parties formally starting a business collaboration and/or partnership - Local public parties

comment.narrative: 6 CE projects were designed by the municipalities of La Molina, Pueblo Libre, Callao, Lima and San Juan de Lurigancho. The projects include cooperation for waste management activities with : - 3 small scale waste recycler associations: Iindependent recyclers association -ATRIMAC; Environmental recyclers association -ATRAC; and United workers of Callao association -ATURCA). - Independent recyclers identfied by the local municipalities.

title.narrative: Number of strengthened government organisations for a sustainable business climate - Total

comment.narrative:
1 strategic training on Circular Economy fconsidting of: - 4 virtual workshops for strategic advice with the Ministry of Production of Peru (PRODUCE) and key partners for the implementation of the roadmap for circular economy in the industrial sector of Peru. - 3 presential workshops with decision makers of the Ministry of Environment of Peru (MINAM) about material flows and cross sector alignment.
Additional (not counted): 1 training on Circular Economy for 37 paerticipants of the following ministries of the Peruvian government: Environment (MINAM), Production (PRODUCE), Agriculture and Irrigation (MINAGRI), International Commerce and Tourism (MINCETUR), Housing, Building and Sanitation (MVSC), Export Promotion Office (PromPerú). The training introduced the conceptual bases and public management mechanisms for circular economy. It also also promoted inter-institutional articulation and helped to unify the criteria about how public management should contribute in the transition from a lineal to a circular economy in

title.narrative: Description of changes achieved in laws, regulations, policy plans, outcomes of social dialogue or development strategies enacted or adopted by local government or social dialogue partners, yielding tangible benefits to the business climate

comment.narrative: 11 action plans for the development of policy instruments to enable the promotion and operationalization of Circular Economy in the peruvian private sector. These action plans consider the methodology and the resources required to develop guidelines for implementation of best manufacturing practices in industries and resources such as lead waste, construction waste, fishery residues, biomass of the sugarcane and quinoa crops, and plastics. Complementary action plans include policy mechanisms such as circular agreements in the plastics industry, a waste exchange platform, a platform for indicators of circularity, and a platform for information on circularity of export products.

title.narrative: Number of courses/trainings developed/adopted for local dissemination - Total

comment.narrative: 15 Peruvian circular economy cases were documented to be used as material in dissemination activities. The cases include diverse initiatives of Peruvian companies, in the field of waste recycling, re-use of materials and cases illustrating the extension of lifespan in sectors such as tanneries (2 cases), biomass (4 cases), chemical industry (4 cases), construction waste (2 cases), and industry (3 cases).

title.narrative: Number of people trained or skills developed - Gender unspecified economic institutions employees

comment.narrative: 21 representatives of the PET value chain including municipalities representing recycler associations and companies.

title.narrative: Number of people trained or skills developed - Gender unspecified government officials

comment.narrative: among them: 41 decision makers of diverse institutions such as ministries of Environment, Production, Agriculture, Housing, International Commerce, the Export promotion office PromPeru, and the Technological Institute for Production; 32 technical level professionals of the Ministry of Production; 37 technical level professionals of diverse Ministries (Environment, Housing, Agriculture, Commerce);
